standard.description: Tests that are specific to the Millenium Gen2 project

test.test_name: Applications should have the correct initialization and cleanup
test.query_clob:
select case when lower(aa.db_session_init_code) = 'aha_apex_global_event.initialization;'
            and lower(aa.db_session_cleanup_code) = 'aha_apex_global_event.cleanup;'
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       aa.workspace,
       aa.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       aa.created_by,
       aa.created_on,
       aa.last_updated_by,
       aa.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) has misconfigured initialization and cleanup settings', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) should have `aha_apex_global_event.initialization;` as its initialization (currently `%2`) and `aha_apex_global_event.cleanup` as its cleanup (currently `%3`)', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id,
        p2 => aa.db_session_init_code,
        p3 => aa.db_session_cleanup_code) issue_title,
       aa.application_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aa.application_name,
       aa.alias,
       aa.availability_status,
       aa.db_session_init_code, 
       aa.db_session_cleanup_code
from apex_applications aa
where aa.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and aa.owner not in ('SVT','AST')
test.explanation: Applications should have have \`aha\_apex\_global\_event.initialization;\` as its initialization and \`aha\_apex\_global\_event.cleanup;\` as its cleanup
test.fix: Go to `Edit application definition` > `Security` >Â `Initialization PL/SQL Code` & `Cleanup PL/SQL Code`
